item.title: [DISTRELEC-7834] Shopsettings can not be saved
item.description:
Hi Ruben

Could you please check?

Its reproducable on Q.

Thx
Will

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Note:
It changes the language of the website correctly.
But it does not update the label on the top right corner

Hey Will,

It looks the Backendata is not reflecting the language change.
For example in CH I am always receiving "DE" as a language. Even if I change to FR/EN.

backenddata.jsp
	data-language="${currentLanguage.isocode}" 
	data-language-label="${currentLanguage.nativeName}"

Could you please have a look? If needed come back to me
Thanks
committed to branch v4.1. Ready for Q deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7829] Modification and fixes of catalog browse layout
item.description:
Next steps for the front end:

logo:
move it further down, center the logo hoizontally within the searchbar - and make sure that it stays like this also when you scroll down (sticky header)

sticky header:
don't move it 10px to the left when starting

main nav:
align vertically with searchbox (move 310px to the right (check px))

breadcrumb:
also align with searchbox (margin to the left of 320px)

catalog browse:
move it up (around 50px)

reduce withspace between main nav and start of content (cat browse, breadcrumb, in general templates)

DISTRELEC-7769:
add it to next Q deployment (have a look at it again)

check footer:
alignment left, expand it, make sure that everything is visible and that the complete footer and the newsletter box are centered within the 1280px
grey background needs to expand endlessly

support and feedback buttons:
right align them within the 1280px

the complete page is missing 10px, add them next to the catalog browse nav. (300px+20px+960px)

Requested by Rene Haemmerli | Distrelec:
Make all links clickable by default in MainCategoryNav
item.summary: Modification and fixes of catalog browse layout

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please test after the next deployment

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
• CategoryPageController -> cat_L3 requests
  • FactFinderSearchImpl.doSearch() -> executeSearch -> convertResult EXPENSIVE! -> SearchResponseConverter -> ResponseFilterBadgesPopulator EXPENSIVE! -> refineQueryAddFacet -> getCategoryForNameDownwards -> refactor

We need to refactor CategoryNavigationHelper.getSubCategoryForName()

quick info about the functionality: method is for fetching sub categories provided by FF with category name
committed to branch v4.1. Ready for Q deployment.

it's a matter of minutes. But let's sit together to do it

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7028] Suggestion layer - tracking
item.description:
The tracking of the suggestion layer is only implemented via Webtrek for the product suggestion, but there is no tracking implemented for the category suggestions, manufacture suggestions nor the search suggestions.

It seems a Fact Finder standard feature to be able to track the suggestion layer, as can be read on the pdf:

"In order to track how many users actually use the suggestion produced by the Suggest module, and therefore automatically help to optimise the suggestions, you must integrate a tracking solution. The necessary tracking parameters are already contained within the returned Search parameters URL. Therefore, normally only this URL needs to be used and the parameters simply have to be passed through.
If you are unable or do not want to use the supplied search parameters URL, you must add the tracking parameters to the search calls yourself.
You can inspect the log file analysis to determine how many search queries are generated by the Suggest module. To do this you need to ensure that such search queries are supplied with the parameter queryFromSuggest=true.
If you want to track what terms are suggested for what inputs, you also need to pass the original term entered by the user as the value for the parameter userInput. For example, if many users select “Paracetamol” from the list after typing “pa” then this entry will be ranked higher and will appear further up in the list."

As a practical example, you can check the conrad website, links after clicking on the suggest layer are like this:
http://www.conrad.biz/ce/de/brand/trendwerk77?queryFromSuggest=true

Please implement the Fact Finder standard tracking, accordingly.

Thank you,
Laura

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Hi Will, Please estimate, thx.

Hi all

Should be a simple implementation, just adding the parameter queryFromSuggest=true to all suggestion links and pass it through to FF in the FF request.

Cheers
Will

http://test.distrelec.ch/de/led-streifen-rgb-24-vdc-4000-mm-osram-ledstrip-flex-lf05ce-rgb1/p/11073195?q=*&filter_queryFromSuggest=true

?q=*&filter_queryFromSuggest=true triggers FF tracking request.

FF tracking request:

<soap:Envelope
    xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
    <soap:Body>
        <logInformation
            xmlns="http://ws69.webservice.adapters.factfinder.de"
            xmlns:ns2="http://ws69.webservice.factfinder.de">
            <in0>distrelec_Q_7310_ch_de</in0>
            <in1>
                <entry>
                    <key>sid</key>
                    <value>559902EA506D41329163220C3E712932</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>origPageSize</key>
                    <value>10</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>masterId</key>
                    <value>11073195</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>query</key>
                    <value>*</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>origPos</key>
                    <value>1</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>class</key>
                    <value>class com.namics.hybris.ffsearch.data.tracking.FactFinderTrackingData</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>pos</key>
                    <value>1</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>id</key>
                    <value>11073195</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>title</key>
                    <value>LED-Streifen RGB 24 VDC 4000 mm</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>page</key>
                    <value>1</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>event</key>
                    <value>click</value>
                </entry>
                <entry>
                    <key>channel</key>
                    <value>distrelec_Q_7310_ch_de</value>
                </entry>
            </in1>
            <in2>
                <ns2:password>c156fb175babbf953ee0c4c6e6abc855</ns2:password>
                <ns2:timestamp>1436184450538</ns2:timestamp>
                <ns2:username>webservice</ns2:username>
            </in2>
        </logInformation>
    </soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

FF tracking response:

<soap:Envelope
    xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"
    xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <soap:Body>
        <ns1:logInformationResponse
            xmlns:ns1="http://ws69.webservice.adapters.factfinder.de">
            <ns1:out>true</ns1:out>
        </ns1:logInformationResponse>
    </soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>
Committed to trunk (v3.6). Ready for Q deployment.

Hi,
I tested in CH_EN, for suggested "Search Terms" the tracking via the URL is not working, (see screenshot). Is there a reason why it was not implemented for the suggested "Search Terms"? If it does not have any consequences, please implement the same logic as well for "Search Term".

In addition, the "query from suggest" appears on the filter grouping area, "QueryFromSuggest" is only a tag in the URL, it must never be visible on the shop. (http://jira.distrelec.com/secure/attachment/19332/QueryFromSuggest_groupingarea.png)

Like this it cannot go live

Thank you
Laura

I have reverted this changes. 

r14249 | rhaemmerli | 2015-07-30 12:54:49 +0200 (Thu, 30 Jul 2015) | 3 lines

DISTRELEC-7028 revert commit 14021,14020

@Will

Please make a make of proper implementation of this.
René
Deployment of v3.6.2 to Q done, please test.
This ticket has been deployed to production. (04.08.2015)

Hi Rafael

Can you give me a status update? Who did the implementation? What was changed?

As I can see so far, there is no comment from my side. So I was not the one who did the implementation?

Thx
Will
René updated me, everything is clear now.
Solved in v4.1.0, committed to trunk. Ready for Q Deployment.
please verify on Q.

Hi Will,
The "Search Terms" and the "Product suggestions" do not contained the parameter in the URL (queryFromSuggest=true). Please implement the parameter also for those suggestions.
"Cateogry suggestions" and "Manufactures/Bradns" are ok.
Thanks,
Laura
I will do so.
committed to branch v4.1, ready for Q deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7763] Exception: LV English brings on shopsettings error
item.description: goto http://www.elfadistrelec.lv/ select English. It will bring you to http://www.elfadistrelec.lv/_s/shopsettings (The Website cannot Display the page). The Latvian language works.
item.summary: Exception: LV English brings on shopsettings error

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment:
@Will can you please fix the exception.

A proper handling of the country list will be implemented in: DISTRELEC-7579 Re
Since when are we using EN for LV? We even dont have a LV EN FF channel at all.

Yes that correct, but the user shouldn't get an exception.
Instead he should be redirected to the default language.

Hint: remove countries having a distrelec shop from the delivery countries of the export shop

/distrelecB2Bfacades/src/com/namics/distrelec/b2b/facades/storesession/impl/DefaultDistrelecStoreSessionFacade#getAllSiteSettings()

{"languages":{"lv":"Latviešu"},"currencies":{"EUR":"Euros"},"channels":{"B2B":"Distrelec Business Customer","B2C":"Distrelec Private Customer"},"country":{"LV":"Latvia"}}
